actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.
Reported to House from the Committee on the Judiciary with amendment, H. Rept. 94-714.
Measure called up by special rule in House.
Motion to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary rejected in House.
Measure failed of passage in House, roll call #129 (229-181).

official_title: Joint resolution to amend the Constitution to provide for representation of the District of Columbia in the Congress.

summary.as: Motion to recommit bill as amended in Senate
summary.text: (Motion to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary rejected in House) Constitutional Amendment - Amends the Constitution by empowering the people of the District of Columbia to elect one Representative in Congress and, as may be provided by Federal law, one or more additional Representatives or Senators, or both, but not exceeding the number to which the District would be entitled if it were a State. Requires that vacancies in such offices be filled by election.

titles.title: Joint resolution to amend the Constitution to provide for representation of the District of Columbia in the Congress.
